dt: {bc}expressed in or utilizing a decimal system especially with a decimal point

et: French {it}décimal{/it}, from Medieval Latin {it}decimalis{/it} of a tithe, from Latin {it}decima{/it} tithe {ma}{mat|dime|}{/ma}
shortdef: based on the number 10; especially : expressed in or utilizing a decimal system especially with a decimal point
any real number expressed in base 10; especially : decimal fraction

dt: {bc}a fraction (such as .25 = ²⁵/₁₀₀ or .025 = ²⁵/₁₀₀₀) or mixed number (such as 3.025 = 3²⁵/₁₀₀₀) in which the denominator is a power of 10 usually expressed by use of the decimal point

shortdef: a fraction (such as .25 = 25/100 or .025 = 25/1000) or mixed number (such as 3.025 = 325/1000) in which the denominator is a power of 10 usually expressed by use of the decimal point

dt: {bc}the position of a digit as counted to the right of the decimal point in a decimal

shortdef: the position of a digit as counted to the right of the decimal point in a decimal

dt: {bc}a period, centered dot, or in some countries a comma at the left of a proper decimal fraction (such as .678) or between the parts of a mixed number (such as 3.678) expressed by a whole number and a decimal fraction

shortdef: a period, centered dot, or in some countries a comma at the left of a proper decimal fraction (such as .678) or between the parts of a mixed number (such as 3.678) expressed by a whole number and a decimal fraction

dt: {bc}a number system that uses a notation in which each number is expressed in base 10 by using one of the first nine integers or 0 in each place and letting each place value be a power of 10
{bc}a system of measurement or currency in which the basic units increase by powers of 10

shortdef: a number system that uses a notation in which each number is expressed in base 10 by using one of the first nine integers or 0 in each place and letting each place value be a power of 10
a system of measurement or currency in which the basic units increase by powers of 10

dt: {bc}a system of classifying books and other publications whereby main classes are designated by a 3-digit number and subdivisions are shown by numbers after a decimal point

shortdef: a system of classifying books and other publications whereby main classes are designated by a 3-digit number and subdivisions are shown by numbers after a decimal point —called also Dewey decimal system

dt: {bc}a decimal in which after a certain point a particular digit or sequence of digits repeats itself indefinitely {dx}compare {dxt|terminating decimal||}{/dx}

shortdef: a decimal in which after a certain point a particular digit or sequence of digits repeats itself indefinitely
